intro: Impatiens teitensis, commonly known as the Teit Island impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the island of Teit in the French Southern and Antarctic Territories. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is perennial and thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Impatiens teitensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
